title: Charlie Walker-Blair
text:
Charlie Walker-Blair (born 24 April 1988) is an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%236.%20%26amp%3B%207.%20Flanker">flanker</a>. He currently plays for <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a>. He has suffered through his career with an <a href="anterior%20cruciate%20ligament%20injury">anterior cruciate ligament injury</a>.
Early life.
Born in <a href="Kent">Kent</a>, he started playing rugby at 15, playing for Taunton and Minehead Barbarians at <a href="Winger%20%28rugby%20union%29">winger</a>. He went to school at <a href="The%20West%20Somerset%20Community%20College">West Somerset Community College</a>, but at the age of 17 went to New Zealand and played for <a href="East%20Coast%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">East Coast</a>; in 2008 he returned to play for Carterton.
Club career.
He played for Exeter, but he injured himself in his first year, which led to a year out. He returned in 2011 and was dual-registered with <a href="Cornish%20Pirates">Cornish Pirates</a>, but re-ruptured his <a href="anterior%20cruciate%20ligament">anterior cruciate ligament</a> and needed another operation, after only playing 12 games. To ease back into rugby he signed for <a href="Taunton%20R.F.C.">Taunton</a>. On 24 February 2013 he signed for <a href="Jersey%20Reds">Jersey</a> in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a>. On 29 April 2013, he signed a deal to join <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a> in the <a href="Aviva%20Premiership">Aviva Premiership</a>.
